name: complaisantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is polite and shows willingness to satisfy others by doing what they want : She was never in any real danger from her complaisantly well-mannered opponent. She would complaisantly allow them to play their rowdy games, without taking part herself.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was widely suspected that some diplomats were very complaisantly disposed towards the fascist government.He complaisantly accepted the fact that his own name was listed in a police report on the group's activities.
